title: Jamaica - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 31 January 2021, in Kingston, Kingston, several armed men in a car drove up to a man and opened fire, killing him. The victim was a former lieutenant of the Shower Posse Gang. It is said that tensions in Denham Town rose following the killing, and that a reprisal attack was launched within 15 minutes of the killing. 1 fatality.
On 26 January 2021, in Hatfield, Manchester, two gunmen shot and killed a man. 1 fatality.

On 25 January 2021, in Kingston, Kingston, gunmen drove up to a group of people in Arnett Gardens and opened fire (drive-by), hitting three of which two fatally. Residents say that the gunmen were police but this is disputed by authorities. 2 fatalities.
On 24 January 2021, in Kingston, Kingston, two men on a motorcycle opened fire on an illegal party in Denham Town, hitting 6 people. No fatalities.
On 22 January 2021, in Kingston, Kingston, gunmen in a car opened fire on a man in the Bay Farm Road area, killing him (drive-by). 1 fatality.
On 21 January 2021, near Treasure Beach, Saint Elizabeth, two men and a woman opened fire on a man from a car (drive-by), killing him. They were arrested soon after. 1 fatality.

On 20 January 2021, in Portmore, Saint Catherine, police clashed with three gunmen after receiving information that they were on their way to kill a person. During the clash, two of the gunmen were killed and the third escaped. 2 fatalities.
On 17 January 2021, in Montego Bay, Saint James, a group of several gunmen drove up to a party and shot the partygoers, including an elderly woman. Two people were killed. 2 fatalities.
On 17 January 2021, in Kingston, Kingston, armed men in a car pulled up to a group of people in Allman Town and opened fire (drive-by). Five people were hit of which three died. 3 fatalities.
On 16 January 2021, in Montego Bay, Saint James, a two day curfew was imposed in the Norwood area following two fatal shootings. It was extended to remain in place until 31 January 2021.

On 16 January 2021, in Montego Bay, Saint James, gang members shot and killed a man in the Norwood area, set a car on fire and peppered several others with bullets before getting away. The shooting is reportedly connected to another shooting in the same community a day earlier in which two people died. 1 fatality.
Around 15 January 2021 (month of), in Montego Bay, Saint Andrew, a gang members was shot by members of another gang while he was buying drugs. No fatalities.

On 15 January 2021, in Montego Bay, Saint James, gang members shot and killed two people and injured another at a bar in the Holleywood section of the Norwood area. The shooting is reportedly connected to a flare up in gang violence. 2 fatalities.
On 15 January 2021, in Kingston, Kinston, gunmen in a car opened fire on three men standing along the road, hitting all three (drive-by). 3 fatalities.
On 12 January 2021, in Kingston, Kinston, a man was shot and killed near Maxfield Avenue by gunmen in a drive-by shooting. 1 fatality.

On 10 January 2021, in Portland parish (coded at capital Buff Bay), police broke up an illegal party in the Sanshore district which was violating coronavirus regulations. When police looked for one man, the crowd started throwing stones at the police. [size=no report]
On 9 January 2021, in Kingston, Kingston, a car drove up to a group of men and the occupants opened fire (drive-by), killing one man. 1 fatality.

On 9 January 2021, in Kingston, Kingston, a woman was shot and killed in Trench Town. The shooting is reported to be related to an ongoing gang feud between the Socks Gang and the Brooklyn Gang. 1 fatality.

On 8 January 2021, in Montego Bay, Saint James, residents of the Greenwoods neighbourhood protested after their community was flooded, allegedly as result of a development project that is taking place in the area. [size=no report]

On 7 January 2021, in Kingston, Kingston, a two day curfew was imposed in parts of Trench Town after tensions in that part of town rose following a number of shootings. Police also erected barricades to prevent drive-by shootings.

On 6 January 2021, in Kingston, Kingston, gunmen on motorcycles opened fire on a taxi in which an infamous gangster and former member of the Gideon Warriors Gang was being transported. Five people were hit, and 1 occupant of the taxi was killed. 1 fatality.
On 3 January 2021, in Montego Bay, Saint James, a joint police and military operation led to the death of a man. A 9mm pistol was seized from the man. 1 fatality.

On 27 December 2020, in Mandeville, Manchester, police went to the house of a top tier member of the Lion Paw Gang and the Bucknor Gang in the May Day area to arrest him. Upon seeing the officers, the man came out with two women as a human shield. A tussle ensued during which the man drew a weapon, after which police shot and killed him. The victim had been wanted by the police since 2015 and was a suspect in one murder case and a person of interest in 11 others. 1 fatality.

On 26 December 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, police officers on patrol heard gunshots in the Rose Town area and went to investigate. Upon arriving at the scene, they saw a group of armed men who were known to the police. A fire-fight ensued and the men fled. No fatalities reported.
On 23 December 2020, in Montego Bay, Saint James, a curfew was imposed for two days in the Norwood area in response to an increase in gang violence. Residents have to stay inside during curfew hours.

On 20 December 2020, in Mandeville, Manchester, police intercepted gunmen who were on their way to shoot someone. They got into a firefight during which one of the gunmen was killed and the other arrested. Two police officers were injured. 1 fatality.

On 18 December 2020, in May Pen, Clarendon, a 96 hour curfew was imposed after seven people were killed by gunmen in a 48-hour period. During the curfew, security forces hunt for the gunmen and nobody is allowed outside during curfew hours.

Around 17 December 2020 (as reported), in Effortville, Clarendon, gunmen shot and killed five people in a series of attacks and injured three others. The attacks were related to a gang feud which flared up in the area after a prank on a gang member got out of hand. 5 fatalities.
On 17 December 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, a man and a boy were on a motorcycle in Mountain View when two men shot at them. The boy was killed and the man injured. 1 fatality.

On 15 December 2020, in Discovery Bay, Saint Ann, a car drove up and a man with a gun got out of the backseat. The man opened fire on two men, killing them both, before getting in the car again. It is reported that the incident is related to a lottery scam gone wrong. 2 fatalities.

On 14 December 2020, near Brown's Town, Saint Ann, residents of the Saint D'Acre hamlet demonstrated by setting tires on fire, after an off-duty police officer shot and killed a neighbour in a dispute over water. [size=no report]

On 13 December 2020, near Brown's Town, Saint Ann, residents of the Saint D'Acre hamlet demonstrated by setting tires on fire after an off-duty police officer shot and killed a neighbour in a dispute over water. Rioters set a car belonging to the police officer as well as the house of a relative on fire. [size=no report]

On 7 December 2020, in Montego Bay, Saint James, two gunmen walked up to a woman with a baby and kidnapped the child at gunpoint. The kidnappers told the mother they were looking for the child's father and that they would hold the baby until the father would contact them.

On 7 December 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, several armed men opened fire on a group of people, killing one person. While attempting to get away, the alleged gunmen were intercepted by police. 1 fatality.

On 7 December 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, police officers intercepted gunmen who sped away from a crime scene where a man was killed moments before and engaged them in a gun battle. One of the suspects was killed while the other escaped. 1 fatality.
On 5 December 2020, in Croft's Hill, Clarendon, gunmen in a car opened fire on a man standing along the road (drive-by), killing him. 1 fatality.

On 29 November 2020, in Mandeville, Manchester, residents of a community where a car crash took place started throwing rocks and bottles at police who were at the scene. Police had to fire warning shots to disperse the mob. [size=no report]
On 28 November 2020, in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, police officers got into a gunfight with members of the Clansman Gang. Two gang members were killed. 2 fatalities.
On 11 November 2020, in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, a group of people beat an alleged thief. He was severely injured and taken to the hospital. [size=no report]

Around 8 November 2020 (weekend of), in Central Village, Saint Catherine, a shootout between police and armed men led to the death of a man. Police recovered a modified pistol that could fire high calibre bullets from the scene. 1 fatality.
On 31 October 2020, in Cambridge, Saint James, two gunmen opened fire during a funerary wake, injuring four people. No fatalities.
On 29 October 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, two men on a motorcycle opened fire on a man in a car, killing him. 1 fatality.

On 26 October 2020, in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, a shootout took place between two armed men and the police. The two men were killed. One of the men was allegedly a contract killer who was a suspect in 8 active murder investigations. 2 fatalities.
On 24 October 2020, in Rio Bueno, Trelawny, gunmen in two cars cornered a man and shot him in what is described as a gangland killing. 1 fatality.

Around 16 October 2020 (as reported), in Kingston, Kingston, two men were killed after being lured into the Whitehall avenue area. Their decapitated bodies were later found in the street with several gunshot wounds. The head of one of the men was later found. According to reports the killings were a part of an ongoing gang dispute, and rival gang members celebrated the news of the deaths of the two men. 2 fatalities.
On 16 October 2020, in Montego Bay, Saint James, armed men attacked a police officer. The officer shot at the men and killed one. 1 fatality

On 16 October 2020, in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, a clash between the One Order and Clansman Gangs led to two deaths that occurred minutes apart. The two gangs are fighting for control over a lucrative extortion market. 2 fatalities.
On 15 October 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, residents of Waltham Park neighbourhood protested after police shot a man in the area. It is unclear why the man was shot by police. [size=no report]

On 13 October 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, three gunmen drove up to a group of people and opened fire, injuring one. They drove off and nearly hit a pedestrian who shouted at them, causing them to stop and shoot the man, killing him. 1 fatality.

On 13 October 2020, in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, a man was shot dead in a shooting that is related to a clash between the warring Clansman and One Order gangs. The gangs are clashing over control of the extortion marker in the area. 1 fatality. This was the second fatal shooting in 24 hours. 1 fatality.

On 13 October 2020, in Gutters, Saint Elizabeth, military officials were caught by police while smuggling over 1000kg of marihuana in a service vehicle. A gunfight ensued and both the police vehicle and military vehicle were damaged. No injuries were reported, and the two soldiers were arrested. According to reports the soldiers were being paid by a local gang leader.

On 13 October 2020, in Lyssons, Saint Thomas, four gunmen opened fire on a man and killed him at the victim's place of business. The men drove off and later got into a shootout with police. 1 fatality.

On 13 October 2020, in Lyssons, Saint Thomas, four gunmen who were trying to get away after killing a man were confronted by police and got into a shootout. Two of the men were killed and one was arrested. The fourth got away. Police seized AK47 rifles and a car. 2 fatalities.

On 12 October 2020, in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, a man was shot dead in a shooting that is related to a clash between the warring Clansman and One Order gangs. The gangs are clashing over control of the extortion market in the area. 1 fatality.

On 5 October 2020, in Old Pera, Saint Thomas, a group of residents captured and beat three goat thieves. When police arrived, two of the men had escaped but a third was there with chop wounds. Another of the thieves later showed up to the hospital where he was admitted under police guard. One of the thieves later died of his wounds in the hospital. 1 fatality. [size=no report]
On 1 October 2020, in Portmore, Saint Catherine, two gunmen opened fire on a man and a woman, killing both of them. 2 fatalities.
On 30 September 2020, in Savanna-la-Mar, Westmoreland, two men opened fire on a shop, killing two people. One of the suspects later turned himself in while the other remains at large. 2 fatalities.
On 26 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, a police officer was shot dead by unknown gunmen while he was on patrol. One of his attackers also died. 2 fatalities.

On 26 September 2020, in Parry Town, Saint Ann, police officers went to break up a party as part of coronavirus-related curfew measures in place on the island. While officers were arresting a promotor of the party, partygoers threw rocks and other objects at the car's windshield and windows, and slashed the tires. The car had to be transported by a tow truck afterwards. No fatalities. [size=no report]

Around 25 September 2020 (as reported), in Chapelton, Clarendon, an Anglican priest was killed and his naked body was found at the chapel house, with his hands and feet bound. His body was found two days after he was reportedly last seen alive. 1 fatality.
On 23 September 2020, in Falmouth, Trelawny, members of a credit union protested in front of the office of that union against plans to have the manager retire. [size=no report]

On 22 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, two men on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting. According to reports the area has been plagued by a gang war, and while the victim was said not to be involved in a gang, according to residents the shooting reportedly was linked to this gang war. 1 fatality.
On 22 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, a taxi driver was shot dead by individuals driving alongside him in another car (drive-by). 1 fatality.
On 22 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, police responded to a report about a shooting in Denham Town. When arriving, a man shot at the police and managed to get away. No fatalities.

On 21 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, two men were killed by gunmen in a drive-by shooting in the Arnett Gardens area, and a third was injured. According to the police the killing is linked to an ongoing gang war in the area. 2 fatalities.

On 19 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, two gunmen attacked a man in broad daylight in a busy street. A tussle ensued and the victim was shot in the head after which the two men escaped in a car which was waiting for them. 1 fatality.
On 19 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, two gunmen attacked a police car and the police officers returned fire. One officer was wounded in the attack. No fatalities.

On 17 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, four men on two motorcycles drove up to a group of people. The two men driving motorcycles jumped off and drew firearms with which they opened fire. Two women in the group ran off and were chased by the gunmen, who shot them dead. Police believe this was a contract killing. 2 fatalities.

On 17 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, a gang feud in Southside continued with the killing of a man by who gunmen. The gunmen approached a group in a car and opened fire on them. The victim ran away but the gunmen chased him. 1 fatality.

On 17 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, a gang feud in Southside continued with the shooting of a man by two gunmen. The man was taken to the hospital in a serious but stable state. That day, another attack took place. Two gunmen approached a group in a car and opened fire on them. The victim ran away but the gunmen chased and killed him. 1 fatality.

On 15 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, a gang feud in Southside was reignited with the killing of a man. Hours after the initial shooting, a presumed retaliatory attack took place. Two gunmen on a motorcycle opened fire on a man and a woman, hitting both. No fatalities.

On 15 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, police officers heard gunshots and went to investigate. They saw gunmen get away on a bike. On of the men pointed a gun at the officers who returned fire. No fatalities.

On 15 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, a gang feud in Southside was reignited with the killing of a man. The victim was sitting outside when a car pulled up and two gunmen got out, shooting the victim before getting away. The same day, another presumed retaliatory attack took place. Two gunmen on a motorcycle opened fire on a man and a woman, injuring both. 1 fatality.

On 8 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, armed men driving in a vehicle opened fire at a police team. The police started a chase until the car with shooters crashed into another car. The armed men got out and started shooting again. Police returned fire, killing one. The other men escaped. 1 fatality.

On 8 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, a man was shot by armed men in a drive-by shooting. According to residents, the shooting was connected to an ongoing war between local gangs. No fatalities.
On 4 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, police responded to a shooting. Upon arriving at the scene, the gunmen opened fire but missed. No fatalities.
On 4 September 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, two men opened fire on a group of people standing on the side of the road, hitting three men. Two of the injured people died in the hospital. 2 fatalities.

On 20 August 2020, in Kingston, the leader of the Teacher Gang was shot and killed during a police operation specifically targeted at him, after months of investigative work. The man in question was a person of interest in 15 murder cases in the Ocho Rios area according to the police. 1 fatality.

On 13 August 2020, in the Southeast St Ann voting constituency, supporters of the Jamaica Labour party protested following the announcement that their candidate would be taken off the ballot. The candidate was removed from the ticket after not adhering to coronavirus related quarantine after returning from abroad. [size=no report]
On 6 August 2020, in Kingston, two men on a motorcycle opened fire on a group of people in a drive-by shooting before getting away. One man died and two others were injured. 1 fatality.

On 4 August 2020, in Westmoreland parish, police captured a high ranking member of the Kings Valley Gang. The man was wanted for several crimes including murder and had been on Jamaica's most wanted list since 2016.

On 2 August 2020, in Effortville, Clarendon, a joint police/military operation led to an hour-long shootout with members of the Bushman Gang, during which six gunmen were killed and two members of the security forces were injured. Intelligence led the security forces to the hideout of the gang members, who opened fire upon their arrival. Security forces returned fire, killing all six. Two of the men were on Jamaica's most wanted list. 6 fatalities.

On 29 July 2020, in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, a police man was shot dead and his service weapon stolen. Gunshots were heard in a construction site and upon inspection the body was found. 1 fatality.
Around 26 July 2020 (as reported), in Portmore, Saint Catherine, a woman was killed and her burnt body was found with her hands tied behind her back in her burning house. 1 fatality.

On 23 July 2020, in Kingston, two police officers were shot by armed men who then tried to get away. Police returned fire and their car crashed. One man got away and the other was taken to the hospital where he died from his wounds. The man who got away later presented himself at the hospital for treatment and was arrested. 1 fatality.
Jamaica Observer; Jamaica Gleaner; Loop News Jamaica

On 22 July 2020, in Cambridge, Saint James, one of Jamaica's most wanted gang members was shot dead in a confrontation with law enforcement forces. The man was the founder of the Retrieve Gang (also known as Prekeh Gang), and a former high ranking member of the infamous Ratty Gang which dissolved in 2018. When the security forces arrived to his hideout he opened fire with an M16, the security forces returned fire and killed him. 1 fatality.

On 16 July 2020, in Montego Bay, Saint James, during an anti-gang exercise, police got in a shootout with a number of gang members. After the shootout four gang members including an alleged hitman were arrested in what is described as a major breakthrough in anti-gang efforts. Guns and vehicles were seized. No fatalities.

On 14 July 2020, in Montego Bay municipality, Jamaica, two people were killed and 5 were injured during a chase between armed assailants on the Lilliput main road on the outskirts of the city. 2 Fatalities.
On 14 July 2020, in Kingston, three armed men approached a group of people and shot one of them, killing him. 1 fatality.
On 9 July 2020, in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, three men were killed by unidentified gunmen posing as police officers. The three were taken outside and shot execution-style. 3 fatalities.

On 8 July 2020, in Kingston, the community of August Town was declared a Zone of Special Operations (ZOSO) by the government. This neighbourhood is ravaged by gang violence, declaring it a ZOSO is meant to allow police forces to combat rival gangs operating here.
On 8 July 2020, in Bog Walk, Saint Catherine, a man was shot and killed by two unidentified gunmen. 1 fatality.
On 6 July 2020, in Kingston, a man was shot and killed by armed men travelling in a car in a drive-by shooting. 1 fatality.

On 6 July 2020, in Kingston, the creation of a new special taskforce of the police for the entire country was announced. This taskforce will focus exclusively on dismantling and disrupting gang activity.
On 3 July 2020, in Kingston, two armed men opened fire on a group of people, killing one person and injuring another. 1 fatality.
On 29 June 2020, in Kingston, an armed group clashed with the police. A woman died in the shoot-out. No details are given by the police account. 1 fatality.

Around 27 June 2020, in Kingston, a woman was killed in a targeted attack by gang members while asleep in her own home. Her partner was injured. She was pregnant at the time of the attack. It is suspected that this was a reprisal for the killing of another woman in Kingston hours earlier. That day, another pregnant woman was killed in a targeted attack also by gang members while out in the street. 2 fatalities.

On 26 June 2020, in Frankfield, Clarendon, two men were travelling in a car when they were shot and killed by gunmen firing at them from two other cars in a drive-by shooting. Five men were later arrested for the attack. 2 fatalities.

On 22 June 2020, in Montego Bay, Saint James, a popular event promotor in the city was shot and killed by two armed men who drove up in a car and got out to shoot him. The attackers then sped away in the car. 1 fatality.
On 17 June 2020, in Bounty Hall, Trewlawny, a man pointed a gun at police and fired. Police returned fire and killed the man. 1 fatality.
On 17 June 2020, in Christiana, Manchester, a man was attacked by two gunmen. The victim was armed himself and returned fire, killing one. In the attack he was wounded. 1 fatality.

On 15 June 2020, in Stewart Town, St. Mary, police shot and killed an armed man under unclear circumstances. Police retrieved a handgun from the scene. It is unclear what prompted the police to open fire. The shooting led to riots in the community. 1 fatality.

On 15 June 2020, near Stewart Town, St. Mary, rioters set debris on fire and blocked the Northern Coastal Highway after police shot and killed a resident of that community shortly before. Jamaica Defence Force later cleared the debris. [size=no report]

On 14 June 2020, in Kingston, a state of emergency was declared in Western and Central Kingston. The reason for the state of emergency is the increase in gang activity in these parts of the city, after a gun-sale gone wrong led to two deaths.

On 13 June 2020, in Little London, Westmoreland, two men on a motorcycle were ordered to stop by four men in a car. The car then intentionally ran into them to knock them off the bike, after which the occupants exited and assaulted the riders with a gun. One of the two got away on the bike and alerted police. No fatalities reported.

On 12 June 2020, in Kingston, a suspect who allegedly shot four police officers, was shot dead by police in a shootout in the Cooreville Gardens area. During the shootout a police officer was wounded. 1 fatality.

On 12 June 2020, in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, four police officers were ambushed by a group of armed men in Horizon Park. The police came under heavy gunfire. Two officers died and the other two were wounded. One of the two wounded officers died two weeks later in the hospital. 3 fatalities.

On 8 June 2020, in Kingston, an hour-long gunfight took place between law enforcement officers and a criminal group in the west of the city. Police came under gunfire from men carrying high powered weapons during an operation. A market in the area went up in flames, police believe the armed group set this fire. No fatalities reported.
On 8 June 2020, in Walkerswood, Saint Ann parish, two gunmen attacked and killed a resident of the community. The gunmen ran but were chased by residents who captured one and killed him. 1 fatality.

On 8 June 2020, in Walkerswood, St. Anne parish, residents chased two gunmen after they had killed a man. The vigilantes managed to capture one of the gunmen and stoned and cut him to death. 1 fatality. [size=no report
On 6 June 2020, in Kingston, protests in support of the Black Lives Matter movement took place in at least three separate places in the city, including in front of the US Embassy. [size=no report]

On 5 June 2020, in Kingston, a demonstration took place in the Cockburn Gardens neighbourhood following the fatal shooting of a resident of that area by the police. Demonstrators demanded justice for the fatal shooting. At least one car was set on fire, two marked police vehicles were damaged and a passing motorcyclist was injured when stones were thrown at him. [size=no report]

Around 4 June 2020, in Kingston, a woman was killed in a stabbing. Her body was found gagged in the trunk of a car. Media reports claim that the killing was related to the killing of a man earlier in that same week. 1 fatality.

On 4 June 2020, in Spur Tree, Manchester parish, police officers located over 1100 kg of marihuana in the bush off Alligator Pond road. The drugs has an estimated street value of over 10 million USD. Nobody was arrested in relation to the find.

On 4 June 2020, in Kingston, a small protest in solidarity with the Black Lives Matter movement took place in front of the US Embassy. The Ambassador joined the protesters. A second small protest took place elsewhere in Kingston as well. [size=no report]

On 3 June 2020, in Kingston, armed clashes between warring gangs led to the death of two men, said to be brothers. The men were standing in a group when armed men in a car pulled up and opened fire. 2 fatalities.
On 1 June 2020, near Race Course, Clarendon, a former soldier was gunned down by armed men on Kemp's Hill. He died in the hospital. 1 fatality.
On 29 May 2020, in Lacovia, St. Elizabeth, police looking for fugitives went to the house of a man, who pointed a firearm at them. Police shot and killed the man. 1 fatality.

On 29 May 2020, in Kingston, armed men shot and injured three civilians during an attack on their home in August Town. It is unclear why this house was attacked. The situation in August Town has been tense since a woman was killed on 27 May 2020 in a clash between state forces and armed gang members. 0 fatalities.

On 27 May 2020, in Kingston, a clash between police and military forces and armed gang members in the August Town neighbourhood led to the death of a woman living in the community. The clash broke out when the officers were attacked by the gunmen. It is alleged that the woman - who had a disability - was killed by a soldier's bullets. 1 fatality.
On 23 May 2020, in Seaton Crescent, Westmoreland, two armed men shot and killed a person in his house. No stolen items were reported. 1 fatality.
On 22 May 2020, in Leith Hall, St. Thomas Parish, armed men shot at a couple at their house, killing the man and injuring the woman. No motive has been established. 1 fatality.
On 19 May 2020, in Kingston city, an armed individual opened fire on a police team during a patrol in the Western part of the city. No fatalities.

Around 15 May 2020 (month of), in Ocho Rios, Saint Ann, a man was shot on orders of the leader of the Teacher Gang. The victim was the cousin of a rival gang leader. Armed men broke into his house as he slept and shot and injured him. No fatalities.
On 9 May 2020, in Kingston city, a man was shot by a soldier while he was eating. A neighbour who was standing next to him was injured. 1 fatality.

On 6 May 2020, in Kingston city, inhabitants of Denham Town attacked police officers after two children were killed by gunmen in this neighbourhood. When a man was arrested in connection to the killing, inhabitants began throwing stones at officers, hitting one in the head. [size=no report]

On 6 May 2020, in Kingston city, a child was killed by a gunman in what authorities suspect is a gangland reprisal for an earlier killing of a different child by armed men, also in Kingston. 2 fatalities.

On 4 May 2020, in Spur Tree, Manchester parish, police and narcotics officers discovered nearly 4000 kilograms of marihuana, with an estimated street value of 35 million USD. The seizure is being labeled the biggest ever marihuana bust in Jamaica. Four persons were arrested.

On 1 May 2020, in Montego Bay, Saint James Parish, a man shot at a private security guard after the man was told to adhere to social distancing protocols related to the coronavirus. This led to an altercation in which the security guard hit the man with his baton several times. A bystander was wounded. No fatalities reported.

Around 1 May 2020 (month of), five people were killed and their bodies buried in a shallow grave in Kingston city. The bodies were wrapped in plastic and had started decomposing at the time of discovery on 12 May 2020. The police opened an investigation to determine whether the bodies are of men missing from Clarendon over a month ago. 5 fatalities.
On 26 April 2020, in Steer Town, Saint Anne Parish, a man was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting. 1 fatality.

On 24 April 2020, in Kingston, two armed men shot at a group of children celebrating a birthday, killing two and injuring five. Police believes it to be a retaliation for an earlier murder. 2 fatalities.

On 23 April 2020, in Green Island, Hanover Parish, four men walked into an ambush and were shot at by armed men. One of the men is wounded in the hospital while the three others are missing and presumed dead. 3 fatalities.
On 22 April 2020, in Kingston, armed men shot at police during a search for the escapees from the Hunt's Bay jailbreak. One of the men died. 1 fatality.

On 21 April 2020, in Kingston, a shoot-out between two men and the police in Riverton City resulted in the death of one of the men. Another man -- said to be one of the men who escaped from Hunt's Bay prison -- was injured. 1 fatality.
On 20 April 2020, in Portmore, Saint Catherine, one of the prisoners who escaped from Hunt's Bay a day earlier was shot dead by police during a shoot-out. 1 fatality.
On 15 April 2020, in Kingston, a man, who was assaulted and shot at earlier that day, attacked one of his alleged attacker with a group of armed men, killing him. 1 fatality.
On 15 April 2020, in Kingston, a man was beaten, chopped with machetes and then shot at by two men. He managed to escape. No fatalities reported.

Around 15 April 2020 (month of), in Ocho Rios, Saint Ann, two men were killed on the instruction of the Teacher Gang leader. The killing was part of an ongoing gang war and following accusations that one of the victim was a police informant. 2 fatalities.

On 12 April 2020, near Cambridge, St. James parish, police opened fire on a group of men who were in breach of the coronavirus curfew. The men were outside playing a game when police drove up, causing them to run. According to eyewitnesses, police opened fire unprovoked and injured one man, while police officers state that they were shot at first and only returned fire. 0 fatalities.
On 10 April 2020, in Montego Bay, St. James parish, a group of armed men in two cars opened fire on a crowd in a drive-by shooting, killing two men.

On 6 April 2020, in St Thomas Parish, sugar workers allegedly burned down 100 acres of farmland after the farms that they worked for were excluded from government grants to compensate those affected by the closure of a sugar factory in the Parish. [size=no report]
Police Forces of Jamaica (2016-) Prison Guards

On 5 April 2020, in the Richmond Farm Correctional Facility near Port Maria, St. Mary Parish, a brief riot of prisoners caused by a physical altercation between a guard and a prisoner over a phone led to at least seven guards being injured. Military forces had to come and put down the riot. [size=no report]
On 3 April 2020, in Four Paths, Clarendon, one man died and another was injured in a shootout between police and armed men.
On 1 April 2020, in Kingston, a man was shot and killed by the occupants of a car in a drive-by shooting.
On 24 March 2020, throughout Jamaica the ports and airports were closed to incoming persons to prevent the spread of coronavirus.

On 24 March in Kingston, Saint Andrew Parish, police and military forces responded to reports of gunfire. Upon arrival the officers saw a dead body in the street and were fired upon. A police officer and a soldier were injured during the gunfire.

On 24 March 2020, in Montego Bay, St James Parish, a man was shot dead in what is reported to be a gang-related revenge killing, in response to the event on 22 March 2020 in which shooters from a car opened fire upon a crowd of people. 1 fatality.
On 23 March, in Montego Bay, St James Parish, three man were shot at by a gunman. One man was killed, he is alleged to be the leader of the Hugga Lane gang. 1 fatality.
On 22 March 2020, in Bog, Westmoreland, two armed men approached a group standing at a carwash and opened fire on them, killing two. 2 fatalities.
On 22 March 2020, in Kingston, St Andrews Parish, three men died in a drive-by shooting after two men drove up to a crowd and opened fire upon them. 3 fatalities.
On 21 March 2020, in Kingston, St Andrew Parish, the body of a woman was discovered in a house. It is reported that the killing was a result of a gang-feud. 1 fatality.
On 20 March 2020 in Portmore, St Catherine parish, a police officer was shot and wounded by a group of armed men.
On 18 March 2020, in Portmore, St Catherina, a man was chased and killed by a group of vigilantes after he robbed a woman of her bag and cellphone. 1 fatality. [size=no report]
On 5 March 2020, in Darliston, Westmore, a vigiliante mob killed an alleged robber. [size=no report]
On 3 March 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, the police exchanged fire with two men affiliated with organised crime. They were both arrested.
On 26 February 2020, in Kingston, two teenage men escaped after they were discovered by police carrying a barrel containing the dead body of a woman that was bound on hands and feet.

On 26 February 2020, in Kingston, a man was shot and killed by two gunmen on the street. Police are investigating possible links to an ongoing feud between gangs from inner city communities known as 'Common' and 'Ackee Walk'.
On 25 February 2020 in Negril, a security guard and his 18-year-old daughter were shot and killed by two gunmen in a shop.
Around 24 February 2020 (as reported), in Hanover outside Lucea, a school bus driver was shot and killed by a high school by two men on a motorcycle.

On 19 February 2020 in Montego Bay, a joint police and military team had a shootout with a criminal group, three members of the group were shot, two of them fatally. The two were wanted by police for shooting episodes.
On 17 February 2020 in Arnett Gardens, Kingston, a man was shot and killed. He had worked with youth affected by crime in the neighborhood through the the Peace Management Initiative (PMI).
On 08 February 2020, in Kingston, a man and an 11-year-old boy were shot in a drive-by shooting. They were taken to hospital, their condition is unclear.
On 07 February 2020, in Old Harbour, a woman was shot and killed by three armed men who entered her property. She was the mother of a policeman who had killed a man in a clash the previous week.
On 6 February 2020, in Longville, Clarendon, a policeman shot a man dead. Motive unknown. 1 fatality.
On 04 February 2020, in Kingston, seven people were shot at by attackers driving by in two cars. Three men died from the injuries.

On 02 February 2020 in Kingston, a retired detective sergeant policeman was shot and seriously injured during a shootout, where he is reported to have been attacked by various armed men, he shot back and injured one of them.
On 01 February 2020, in Holland Village outside Santa Cruz, a man was chased and beaten to death by a group of community members because of a rumor that he had attacked a woman. [size=no report]
On 28 January 2020, in August Town, Kingston, a taxi driver was shot and killed by four men when he was arriving to his home and leaving his vehicle.
On 28 January 2020, in Kingston, a man was shot and killed by two men. The man was on bail when he was killed. He had a backpack with a pistol and ammunition on him.
On 25 January 2020, in Kingston, two teachers were attacked by two gunmen outside a high school. One of the teachers was shot dead, before he died he shot and killed one of the attackers.
On 24 January 2020, in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine Parish, two individuals went to buy a firearm when they were shot and killed by three individuals. 2 fatalities
On 23 January 2020 in Kingston, the body of an eight-year-old boy was found with his hands and feet tied. He had been reported missing on January 21.
On 22 January 2020 in Central Village, St Catherine, two men were shot and killed by police after they had opened fire on a police patrol.
On 22 January 2020, off the coast of Portland Cottage in Clarendon, the Jamaica Defence Force (JDF) Coast Guard seized 1895 kilos of compressed ganja on a ship and arrested the three men on board.
On 15 January 2020, in Lucea, Hanover, a minibus driver was stabbed to death by two unknown assailants at a transportation center. 1 fatality.
On 09 January 2020 in Kingston, six people, including a baby, were shot in a drive-by shooting. One woman died in the hospital from her injuries.
On 07 January 2020 in Kingston, a man and a woman, both shopkeepers, were found dead, with gunshot wounds to their heads and their hands and feet bound.
On 05 January 2020 in Rockfort, Kingston, a man was shot dead and a woman injured in a drive-by shooting.
On 05 January 2020 in Portmore, a man was shot and killed, another man shot and injured, when two vehicles approached them and men fired guns at them from the vehicles.
On 27 December 2019 in Longville Park outside May Pen and within Clarendon, a police officer was found dead at her home shortly after finishing her shift.
On 27 December 2019 in Kingston, four people were shot and injured during a gun battle between rival gangs at a bike show.
On 22 December 2019 in Paradise in Norwood, Montego Bay, St James, two students aged 20 and 13 were shot and killed by two unidentified men.
On 17 December 2019 in York Town, outside May Pen, Clarendon, a People_ National Party (PNP) activist was shot dead near his home by unidentified attackers.

On 11 December 2019 in Kingston, a man who was a member of the People's National Party (PNP), an employee of the Ministry of Energy, and a Justice of the Peace, was shot and killed by unknown assailants.

On 08 December 2019 in Kitson Town outside Spanish Town, eight people were shot, four of them fatally, when unidentified gunmen shot at people in a shop and in a bar. The National Security Minister suggested these were gang activities.
On 05 December 2019 in Corner Pond, Port Maria, St Mary, a woman was shot dead by two gunmen who ambushed her on the street.
On 30 November 2019 in Spot Valley, outside Montego Bay in St James, two men were killed and three others injured as two men came out of a car and fired guns at them.
On 26 November 2019 in Kingston, two men were shot, one fatally, by unidentified gunmen who attacked them on the street.

On 25 November 2019 in Kingston, over 300 protesters took the streets to recognize International Day for the Elimination of Violence Against Women in collaboration with the Jamaica AIDS Support for Life (JASL) annual silent protest. [size=over 300]

On 24 November 2019 in Mango Valley, outside Boscobel, St Mary, a man and a woman travelling in a car were ambushed by a group of armed men who opened fire on them, killing the man and injuring the woman.
On 24 November 2019 in Albion, next to Yallahs, St Thomas, a former policeman was shot and killed in his home.
On 23 November 2019 in the Bayshore Park area outside Kingston, masked men entered and opened gunfire at a group at a party, killing two men, injuring six others.

On 16 November 2019 in Exchange, Ocho Rios, a woman was shot and killed when gunmen tried to break into her home, when she tried to block their entry they fired several gunshots inside and she was hit several times. Other family members in the house were unharmed.

On November 3, 2019, in Ocho Rios, there was a shootout when a group of four men fired at a police patrol who fired back, injuring two of the men who later died. The two other men escaped. 2 fatalities.

On October 23, 2019, in Vineyard Town, Kingston, a man entered a doctor_ office and shot at the people inside, killing one man and injuring five others, including one child. The attack is believed to be related to an ongoing feud between rival gangs.
On October 15, 2019, in Kingston, there was a shootout in an area where rival gangs have an ongoing feud. An armed group opened fire on a police vehicle, the police fired back.
On October 10, 2019, in Falmouth, a man was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting. The man was recently released from custody due to his possible involvement with a murder last month.
On October 7, 2019, in Kingston, a man was shot and killed by a group of gunmen.
On October 6, 2019, in Barrett Town near Montego Bay, a man was shot and killed, and three others shot and injured, by an armed group.
On October 4, 2019, in Kingston, there was a shootout between rival gangs, police were present in the area and asking the public to use alternate routes for transportation.
On October 3, 2019, in Kingston, a man was shot and killed in a clash between two local groups.

On 24 September 2019, in Kingston, a bus driver was shot and killed by unidentified armed men in a vehicle while he was standing by the bus. The bus company Jamaica Urban Transit Company (JUTC) is reported to have withdrawn some of its services.

On September 23, 2019, in Lethe, next to Anchovy, St James, a man was shot and killed when two armed men entered his property and shot him multiple times. The man_ eight-year-old granddaughter was also injured by bullets.

On September 22, 2019, in Montego Bay in Saint James, a police officer was shot and injured after he was involved in a collision. He was driving and attacked with guns by the people in the other car involved, and fired his gun back at them.
On September 19, 2019, in Braeton, Portmore, St Catherine, a man was shot and killed in a garage by two men who drove up to a group of men and shot him several times.
On September 17, 2019, in Salt Spring, Saint James, a man was shot and killed by several attackers while visiting a friend.
On September 16, 2019, in the Negril area in Westmoreland, a man was shot and killed and another man injured by two masked men with handguns.
On 14 September 2019, in Kingston, a man was shot dead my armed men in a drive-by shooting. 1 fatality.
On September 13, 2019, in Falmouth, Trelawny, a man was shot and killed by unknown shooters. The man had recently been accused of sexual assault.
On September 13, 2019, in Ocho Rios, two women driving in their car were attacked by unidentified gunmen in a vehicle. One woman; an attorney, was killed, and the other; her mother, was injured.

On September 11, 2019, in Kingston, a man regarded as gang leader was shot several times and injured. A few hours later another man was shot and injured, the police are investigating if it was a reprisal.
On September 5, 2019, in Rose Heights, St James, two men were shot by the police, one of them died. One of the men are reported to have opened fire on the police before they shot him.

On September 5, 2019, in Rose Heights, St James, residents protested after two men were shot by the police, claiming the shooting was unprovoked. They used debris and stones to block the road leading into the community. [size=no report]

On September 4 2019, in Portmore, Saint Catherine, a man and a woman were shot by assailants at their home in the city. The man was killed in the attack, and the woman was injured. The assailants escaped shortly after. Both were taken to the hospital were the man was declared dead.
On September 1 2019, in Temple Hall, Saint Andrew, three people were killed in a shootout carried out by unknown assailants. 2 others were injured in the attack. No more details have been reported.
On August 27 2019, in Bounty Hall, Trelawny, an elderly man was shot and killed by unknown assailants. According to police forces he had been shot some time before and survived the attack.
On August 27 2019, in Kingston city, a woman was shot and killed by members of an armed group in a drive-by while she was driving.

On 22 August 2019, in May Pen, Manchester, a vehicle pulled up to a group of people, armed men came out and shot at them, killing two men and injuring a child. Among the shooter, there was at least one leading member of the Lion Paw Gang. 1 fatality.

On August 17, 2019, in Kingston, a man and a woman were shot and killed by a group of armed men in a vehicle. The victims lived on the same street but the police did not confirm any other connection between them.

August 15, 2019, on Mandela Highway, Spanish Town, a passenger on a bus was shot and killed after two armed men entered the bus and opened fire. In the same town, on the same day, a man was shot and killed when unidentified gunmen entered the bar he was in. 2 fatalities
Around 15 August 2019 (month of), in Ocho Rios, Saint Ann, two men were killed by two gunmen on order of the leader of the Teacher Gang to settle an ongoing dispute in the courts. 2 fatalities.

On August 14, 2019 in Wilton Gardens, Kingston, a man was shot and killed, presumably by the police. According to the police, they retrieved an illegal firearm in the shootout. Reports suggest the man, who was a known local football player, was killed as part of a gang territory fight.
On 13 August 2019, in Spanish Town, a bus driver was killed and two others injured in a shooting incident.
August 11, 2019, in Yallahs, a man was entering his home when he was attacked by unidentified armed men, shot and killed.
On August 10, 2019, in Spanish Town, two men were shot and killed by unidentified armed men.
August 9, 2019, at Old Hope Road, Kingston, a man in the parking lot of a strip club was shot and killed by gunmen on a motorcycle.
On August 8, 2019, in Port Maria, St Mary, a man was shot and killed by a security guard outside a supermarket. Reports say the man had threatened the guard with a metal object.
August 7, 2019, in Old Harbour, two men were shot and killed. Gunshots were heard and police found the men dead.

On August 6, 2019, in Braco, Trelawny, a man was shot and killed, and a man he was talking to was injured, when they were attacked by unknown gunmen. The man killed was suspected for robbery and bomb threats.
On August 1, 2019, in Ocho Rios, two men, known musicians, were in a shop when an armed man entered and shot and killed both before escaping.
O 29 July 2019, in Bog Walk, Saint Catherine Parish, three armed men shot and killed a man for unknown reasons. 1 fatality.
On July 28, 2019, in their home in Eltham Park, Spanish Town, two women were shot and killed by unknown assailants.
On July 27, 2019, in Brown's Hall outside Spanish Town, a man was shot and killed by unidentified gunmen.
On July 26, 2019, in Kingston, a man was shot and killed by unknown assailants.
On July 26, 2019, in Santa Cruz, St Elizabeth, a man was shot and killed by an unidentified man who walked up to him and shot him when he was at a bar at Santa Cruz Market.
On July 24, 2019, in Kingston, police on patrol found a firearm when searching a group of men. Reports say one unidentified man was shot and killed by the police but details are unclear.
On July 24, 2019, unknown gunmen kicked open the door of a home in Havana Heights, in the May Pen area of Clarendon, and shot at a man and a woman there, killing the man and injuring the woman.
On July 24, 2019, in Central Village, St Catherine, police officers were shot at, and after a shootout, a man was shot dead by the police.
On July 22, 2019, in Spanish town, the dead bodies of two women were found, with gunshot wounds and in a state of decomposition.
On July 20, 2019, in Kingston, a man known as a reggae singer was shot and killed.

On July 20, 2019, in the Fyffes Pen area in St Elizabeth, two men were shot and killed, one in the early morning and the other in the evening, police are investigating whether the two deaths were linked, if the second is a reprisal for the first.

On July 18, 2019, unknown gunmen with ballistic vests claiming to be policemen, kicked open the door of a home in Havana Heights, in the May Pen area of Clarendon, and shot at the people there, killing a 15-year old boy.
On July 17, 2019, in Old Harbour, a man was shot in the head and killed at his residence by unknown shooters.

On July 14, 2019, at King Gate Road in St James parish, coded at Montego Bay, one man was shot and killed, another seriously injured, when the car they were driving in was intercepted by soldiers who were part of a military intervention in the area. The men in the car fired at the soldiers, who fired back. The dead man was known as one of Westmoreland's 'most wanted,' police say he was wanted for at least eight murders and shootings in the Bethel Town area.
On July 14, 2019, on Arthur Wint Drive in Kingston, two men on a motorbike drove up and shot at a car where three men were traveling, killing one and injuring two.

On July 12, 2019, at Mount Zion near Barrett Town, Montego Bay, a group of men working was attacked by unidentified gunmen, killing two and injuring two. They also set fire to and partially burnt the bodies of the two dead men. Police are investigating the motive.

On July 10, 2019, at 08:45 AM, at Anchovy, St James, a man was shot and killed on the street by two unidentified armed men. Another unidentified man who was traveling on a bus was injured by a stray bullet.

On July 7, 2019, the Prime Minister declared a state of emergency for St Andrew South area for 14 days. It is the fourth region after Westmoreland, Hanover, and St James to enter into an SOE, due to violence at epidemic proportions; 94 murders in the area this year, up from 79 last year. The PM says gangs and guns are the main cause of death in the country. The SOE is expected to delay traffic.

On July 7, 2019, two men were attacked by unidentified armed men who shot them several times, killing one and wounding the other, who was admitted to hospital. Residents in the community are appealing to authorities for better street lighting in the area to avoid violence.
On July 7, 2019, at a bar on the Bustamante Highway, May Pen, a man was shot several times and killed by unidentified gunmen who then escaped in a vehicle. The man was a local football player.
Police Forces of Jamaica (2016-) Prison Guards

On July 3, 2019, at the Horizon Adult Remand Centre in Denham Town, Kingston, a group of inmates, attacked a prison guard with a makeshift knife. The guard fought back with a baton, killing one inmate, himself ending up seriously injured.

On June 30, 2019, on Tulip Lane, Denham Town, West Kingston, a man was shot and killed by an unidentified group. The police suggest this may be revenge for a killing on June 29 and part of ongoing gang fights.
On June 29, 2019, on Regent street, Denham Town, West Kingston, a man was shot and killed by an unidentified group. The police suggest this is part of ongoing gang fights.

On June 25, 2019, in May Pen, Middlesex County, a soldier that was off duty visiting his family was shot and killed by an unidentified armed group who drove up on a motorcycle. Two others were injured.
On June 18, 2019, in Montego Bay, Cornwall County, two people, a gardener and a young man, were shot and killed by an unidentified armed group in different events.

On June 13, 2019, in Bull Bay, Surrey County, a windscreen wiper was attacked and injured by an unidentified group. A man with a license to have a firearm intervened and shot and injured one of the members of the armed group. 0 fatalities, 2 casualties.
On June 12, 2019, in Bull Bay, Surrey County, 3 men were shot and killed by an unidentified armed group in an attack while they were in a house.
On June 10, 2019, in Kingston, Surrey County, two women were shot and killed by an unidentified armed group while they were in their house.
On June 6, 2019, in Trench Town in Kingston, a wanted man was shot and killed by an unidentified armed group in an armed clash between local gangs.
On June 4, 2019, in Old Harbour, Middlesex County, a man and a woman were shot and killed by an unidentified armed group.
On May 29, 2019, in Half Way Tree, Saint Andrew parish coded at Kingston, an off-duty private security officer was shot and killed by an unidentified armed group.

On May 27, 2019, in Montego Bay, Saint James, Cornwall County, an unidentified armed group shot against a Councilmen who managed to escape with no injuries. No motive for this attack has been specified.
On May 26, 2019, in Annotto Bay, Saint Mary, Middlesex County, a female merchant was shot and killed by two armed men when she was travelling on a motorcycle with a man. The man was injured.

On May 26, 2019, in May Pen, Clarendon, Middlesex County, two officers confronted an armed group that were stealing objects and money from people around the sector. The group had been heavily armed and when they noticed the police forces and shot at them. Both officers were injured.

On May 26, 2019, in Saint Ann's Bay, Middlesex County, a man was shot and killed by an unidentified armed group while he was in his car. Men approached the car while it was standing and killed the man.
On May 25, 2019, in May Pen, Middlesex County, a man was shot and killed and a woman was injured by two men while they were working in a tailor shop.
On May 24, 2019, in May Pen, Middlesex County, two men were killed by two gunmen.

On May 21, 2019, in Montego Bay, Cornwall County, 3 occupants of a truck were shot and badly injured when they were attacked by an unidentified armed group who it was believe wanted to steal money they were transporting.
On May 13, 2019, a man was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in the area of Maxfiel Park, Saint Andrew parish coded at Kingston, Jamaica. The shooting was allegedly gang-related.
On May 8, 2019, a police man was shot and killed by unknown gunmen near a bar in Rollington Town in the Eastern part of the city of Kingston, Surrey County, Jamaica.
On May 6, 2019, a 15-year old boy was stabbed and killed by a group of men in the parish of Saint Andrew parish coded at Kingston, Jamaica.
On May 5, 2019, two people were shot and killed by three unknown gunmen in the city of Sandy Bay, Clarendon, Middlesex County, Jamaica.
On April 25, 2019, an elderly woman was set on fire and died as a result of it by an unknown perpetrator who approached her in her community of Lima, Saint Jams parish, Cornwall County, Jamaica.
On April 25, 2019, following the shooting of a man in Denham Town in Kingston, Jamaica, the gunman was shot and killed by the police.
On April 22, 2019, three people were shot and killed, execution style, by unknown gunmen in the town of Bellefield, Manchester, Middlesex County, Jamaica.
On April 17, 2019, a police station in the city of Spalding, Clarendon, Middlesex County, Jamaica, was attacked by unknown gunmen. One officer was injured during the shooting.

On April 17, 2019, two men were shot by unknown gunmen in a drive-by shooting in the city of Savanna-la-Mar in the parish of Westmoreland, Cornwall County, Jamaica. One man died as a result of his injuries.

On April 17, 2019, a man was killed by residents of Sterling Castle as he was accused of being responsible for the death of a high school student coming from the town in the parish of Saint Andrew in Kingston, Jamaica. [size=no report]

On April 15, 2019, residents of Sterling Castle in the parish of Saint Andrew in Kingston, Jamaica, blocked a road out of protest of the lacking police actions to locate a high school student that had been missing. [size=no report]
On April 13, 2019, a man was shot and killed by unknown gunmen on a motorbike in the Clay Ground area of the Saint Ann parish, Middlesex County, Jamaica.
On April 11, 2019, a woman was shot and killed by unknown gunmen on a motorbike in the Bogue Hill area of Montego Bay, Saint James, Cornwall County, Jamaica.
On April 8, 2019, five people were shot by unknown gunmen in a drive-by shooting in the Olympic Gardens section of Waterhouse in Kingston, Jamaica. Two people died as a result of their injuries.
On 29 March 2019, in Kingston, gunmen shot and killed a man. They opened fire from their vehicle near the national stadium (drive-by).
On March 28 2019, five people were shot by three unknown gunmen in the community of Rose Heights. Two people died as a result of their injuries.
On March 24 2019, a police officer was shot by unknown gunmen during an operation in the area of Willowdene, Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, Middlesex County, Jamaica.

On March 24 2019, a man was shot and killed in his car by unknown gunmen in the city of Negril, Westmoreland, Cornwall County, Jamaica. The victim was recently deported from Canada where he served a prison sentence for drug related breaches.
On March 21 2019, an 18-year old boy was shot and killed by two gunmen in the city of Negril, Westmoreland, Cornwall County, Jamaica.
On March 20 2019, a 76-year old man serving as a security guard for a shop was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in the city of Falmouth, Trelawny, Cornwall County, Jamaica.

On March 18 2019, residents of the Catherine Hall community in the city of Montego Bay, Saint James, Cornwall County, Jamaica, protested the death of a community member earlier that week. The protesters claim the death of the man shot by the police was unjustified. Participants burned debris and made road blockages. [size=no report]
On March 17 2019, a man was shot and killed in his home by unknown gunmen during a drive-by shooting in the parish of Clarendon, Middlesex County, Jamaica.
On March 16 2019, a woman was shot and killed by two unknown gunmen in the city of Trench Town, in Kingston, Jamaica.
On March 13 2019, a woman was shot and killed by several gunmen while sitting outside with relatives in the city of Buff Bay in the parish of Portland, Surrey County, Jamaica.
On March 10 2019, a woman was shot and killed by various gunmen in the Victoria district in the city of Linstead, Saint Catherine, Middlesex County, Jamaica.
On March 10 2019, a man was shot and killed and three others injured when unknown gunmen opened fire from a vehicle on Molynes Road in the parish of Saint Andrew parish coded at Kingston, Jamaica.
On February 27 2019, a shoot out between the police and an armed group took place in Montego Hills, Montego Bay, Saint James parish, Cornwall County, Jamaica.
On February 27 2019, a man was shot and killed during an armed clash with the police in the parish of Saint Catherine coded at Spanish Town, Jamaica. A police officer was injured as well.
On February 27 2019, three men were shot and killed by unknown gunmen in May Pen, Manchester, Middlesex County, Jamaica.
On February 25 2019, three people were killed and five others injured when unknown gunmen opened fire at a bar in the town of Williamsfield, Westmoreland, Cornwall County, Jamaica.
On February 24 2019, a woman was shot and killed and another man injured by unknown gunmen on motorcycles in the town of Lucea, Hanover, Cornwall County, Jamaica.
On February 22 2019, a man was shot and killed by armed gunmen travelling in a car in the town of Kellits, Clarendon, Middlesex County, Jamaica.
On February 21 2019, two people were shot and killed and another man injured in a drive-by shooting in Maverley in Kingston, Jamaica.
On February 8 2019, a decapitated body was found in Central Village, Saint Catherine, Jamaica.
On February 6 2019, a police man was shot and injured by unknown gunmen in Saint Catherine, Jamaica.
On February 5 2019, following the killing of a man by a policeman, riots broke out during which a police car was damaged in Clarendon, Jamaica. [size=no report]
On February 5 2019, a man was shot and killed by a police man in Clarendon, Jamaica.
On February 2 2019, a man was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting in Saint Andrew parish coded at Kingston, Jamaica, by unknown gunmen. The shooting was allegedly gang-related.
On February 2nd 2019, a member of parliament (PNP) was stabbed and killed and found in his home in Port Antonio, Jamaica.

On January 30 2019, a woman and her son were attacked by two unknown men in Zion Hill, Portland, Jamaica. The men threatened the man with a gun to his head, and slit the woman's throat. She died as a result of her injuries.
On January 25 2019, two men were shot and killed after a brief confrontation with the police in Saint Catherine, Jamaica.
On January 24 2019, a man was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in Clarendon, Jamaica, possibly in connection with a gang feud.
On January 24 2019, a police man was shot at in his home in Saint Catherine, Jamaica, by unknown gunmen, during an alleged gang-related execution.

On January 24 2019, a man and a woman were shot and killed by unknown gunmen in Spanish Town, Jamaica, during an alleged gang-related execution.
On January 23 2019, a man was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in Mandeville, Manchester, Jamaica, during an alleged gang-related execution.

On January 23 2019, two men were shot and killed and four other injured in a drive-by shooting in Saint Andrew, Jamaica. The shooting is allegedly the result of an ongoing gang feud.

On January 23 2019, a man was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in Clarendon, Jamaica, possibly in connection with a gang feud. A man and a woman were also shot and killed by unknown gunmen, also possibly in connection with a gang feud.
On January 18 2019, a man was shot and killed in his home in Saint James, Jamaica, by unknown gunmen, during an alleged gang-related execution.
On January 17 2019, two men were shot and killed and two others injured when unknown gunmen opened fire on them while playing dominoes in Clarendon, Jamaica.
On January 16 2019, a man was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in Montego Bay, Jamaica, during an alleged gang-related execution.
On January 13 2019, a man part of the Jamaican defense forces, was shot and killed in Mandeville, Manchester, Jamaica, by unknown gunmen, during an alleged gang-related execution.

On January 12 2019, a man was shot and killed in Ocho Rios, Jamaica, by unknown gunmen, during an alleged gang-related execution.
On January 9 2019, a man was shot and killed in Bull Bay, Saint Andrew, by unknown gunmen, while another man was killed a couple of hours later. The murders are allegedly gang-related.
On January 8 2019, a man was shot and killed during an alleged gang-related execution by an unknown gunmen in Saint Andrew parish coded at Kingston, Jamaica.
On January 8 2019, an 18-year old man was shot and killed in Hanover, Jamaica, by an unknown gunman during an alleged gang-related execution.
On January 7 2019, a man was shot and killed and another injured when unknown gunmen attacked them in West Kingston, Jamaica during an alleged gang-related execution.
On January 6 2019, a 14-year old girl was shot and killed by an unknown gunman in Saint Andrew parish coded at Kingston, Jamaica during an alleged gang-related execution.
On January 4 2019, two people were shot and killed by unknown gunmen in Spanish Town, Jamaica during an alleged gang-related execution.
On January 1 2019, a man was attacked and killed by two unknown men, the bodies of two men who were shot and killed were found in August Town, Kingston, Jamaica.
On 29 December 2018, in Kingston, Saint Andrew, a man was shot dead by three armed men in Papine Square park. 1 fatality
On 28 December 2018, in Kingston, Kingston, a group of people protested to show their disagreement with the termination of a gas station franchise contract. [size=no report]
On 28 December 2018, six people were shot by several gunmen in Clarendon, Jamaica. Two of the victims died as a result of their injuries.

On 24 December 2018, in Mandeville, Manchester, a vendor was shot dead in Mandeville Market by three unidentified men who entered the market. 2 of the attackers were captured after the attack. Motives are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 20 December 2018, an off-duty member of the Jamaica military was shot by unknown gunmen in Spanish Town, Jamaica.

On 11 December 2018, in Kingston, people in Trenchtown, Jamaica, staged a demonstration during which they blocked roads with debris over the shooting of a community member earlier that day. [size=no report]
On 11 December 2018, in Kingston, a man was shot and killed in Trench Town neighbourhood by policemen.
On 9 December 2018, a shooting at the police office in Saint Mary, Jamaica, resulted in the death of a woman and an injured police officer. Details are unclear.
On 6 December 2018, in Portmore, St Catherine, a private security guard who was working at a business outlet was shot dead by two armed men. 1 fatality.
On 29 November 2018, in Montego Bay, St James, a man was shot dead by two armed men outside a nightclub. 1 fatality.
On 23 November 2018, in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, a taxi driver was stabbed to death by several men along Windsor Avenue. Motives of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 21 November 2018, taxi drivers demonstrated agaisnt government regulations in Spanish Town, Georgetown, causing several roads to be blocked and cars to be destroyed.
